article: stories from doctors without borders patients and staff in a war-torn region of iraqfor over 45 years doctors without borders has worked around the world to aid people and communities who are being threatened by violence , neglect , or natural disasters . behind the headlines and viral images of conflict are real lives and real stories of hardship and survival . from local community members to national and international aid workers , no one goes untouched by the violence and chaos . the stories told in `` the beautiful faces of mosul '' are an example of how war is just the beginning of the journey for all involved .

the medical aid provided by doctors without borders in mosul and elsewhere around the world is offered impartially , regardless of race , religion , gender , or political convictions . to ensure its independence , doctors without borders does not accept funding from any government or international agency , making the support of private donors truly invaluable . over 89 % of donations are spent on humanitarian activities . if you are interested in helping doctors without borders make an impact in regions like mosul , please click here or visit donate . doctorswithoutborders . org .
